message:
Probably this is a newbish question but I have searched and couldn't reach a definite answer ...
To point a domain to a server ... DNS records is what I need to update.
A popular company in Egypt providing hosting services is refusing to give their DNS because "You didn't buy your domain from us" and they are only providing "A records" ...
Can the "A record" used instead of the DNS?

Many thanks!

inb4 somebody says that's your mistake for using an Egyptian company for hosting, it isn't for me :D

data.message: بص انا مش فاهم اوي بس لو عايز تربط IP بدومين فعلا بستخدم الـ  A Records بس انا مش فاهم انت جايب Shared Hosting ولا VPS ولا اية؟؟
Your host is that company and you need to point a domain that you purchased from another place to them?
I do not think so, I use a records only for virtual hosts. DNS is just pointing to an A record. So you need to change the DNS to point to the server ip

روح على شركه الهوستينج، و دور على اسم ال DNS بتاعهم
حاجه زى ns1.hostingcompany.com
و بعدين تروح على شركة الدومين، و تغير ال DNS من 
ns.domaincompany.com
الى 
ns1.hostingcompany.com

دى امثله ازاى تلاقى اسم السيرفر بتاع كل شركه:
http://www.inmotionhosting.com/support/domain-names/dns-nameserver-changes
و دى مثال على ازاى تغير الاسم فى الشركه بتاعه الدومين:
https://www.namecheap.com/support/knowledgebase/article.aspx/767/10/how-can-i-change-the-nameservers-for-my-domain

DNS server holds A Records. Here is an example on how Google's DNS server look like:
https://who.is/dns/google.com
Thank you all for your replies :) I didn't wanted a solution, I wanted to understand the problem and what's the difference between the A records and the DNS ... etc. Many thanks again

A Records are like entries in a Dictionary (key: Value) (Name: IP), and the DNS is the actual Dictionary.
I guess your question is "who adds entries in the dictionary?", The answer is the company that owns the Server and knows its IP (The hosting company)
